attributes.action: say no to clause 17 in the proposed Digital Economy Bill
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Digital Economy Bill in the UK is currently going through its second reading process before heading to both committe and report stage.

However at present it still features clause 17, allowing the government to change copyright law as it pleases by statutory instrument rather than the full legislative process.

Although there has been much debate around the Digital Economy Bill, which I hope will be discussed in this group, I hope people will join and say no to this clear disregard of our legal system which could allow Government's to help out personal freinds, donators etc on a whim without proper process.
